issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
h6.Issue
The graphic assets that are in the build directory under Resources/iPhone/Images folder need to be moved to resources/images, and then they show up fine.

h6.How to re-create:
(1) Get Titanium project attached targeting a 3.0.2 build
(2) Run transport.py 
(3) Open in xcode and try to run in iPhone 5

h6.Actual results
You'll see the images missing on the iPhone 5, as well as the appicon.

They are getting put in build/iphone/Resources/iphone/images directory. They have to copy them to the build/iphone/Resources/images directory manually.

They also have to copy the build/iphone/Resources/iphone/appicon@2x.png to the build/iphone/Resources directory manually.
fields.summary: iOS: Transport.py images missing on the iPhone 5
fields.environment:
Platform & version: iOS 6
Titanium Studio version: 3.0.2
Titanium SDK 3.0.2.GA

comments.body: Closing ticket as the issue will not fix.
